0:
routers:
- name: Oracle Cloud, Aus East
  network:
    name: oracle-aue
    display_name: oracle-aue
  nos: linux
  address: localhost
  port: 2222
  credential:
    username: ubuntu
    password: ubuntu
  vrfs:
  - name: global
    default: true
    ipv4:
      source_address: 192.0.2.1
    ipv6:
      source_address: 2001:db8::1

mqtt:
  host: emqx.home.svc.cluster.local
  username: "${SECRET_DOUBLE_TAKE_MQTT_USER}"
  password: "${SECRET_DOUBLE_TAKE_MQTT_PASSWORD}"

frigate:
  url: http://frigate.home.svc.cluster.local:5000
  cameras:
    - amcrest-frontyard
    - amcrest-pool
    - amcrest-turret
    - amcrest-office

  zones:
    - camera: amcrest-frontyard
      zone: outside
    - camera: amcrest-pool
      zone: outside
    - camera: amcrest-turret
      zone: familyroom
    - camera: amcrest-office
      zone: office

  events:

detect:
  match:
    save: true
  unknown:
    save: true

detectors:
  deepstack:
    enabled: true
    url: "http://deepstack.home.svc.cluster.local:5000"
  compreface:
    enabled: false

time:
  timezone: America/New_York

notify:

#!/bin/sh

npm install homebridge-myq
npm install homebridge-nest
npm install homebridge-platform-orbit

/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.title: redis helm release
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.name: redis
/hr/bjw-s.github.io-helm-charts-app-temp.doc:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that is used as a database, cache, and message broker. It provides a fast and flexible solution for storing and retrieving data, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of use cases, including real-time analytics, session management, and more.

Redis is used by Authentik, Authelia, oauth2-proxy.
